[0033] Inhibitors of GSL synthesis enzymes used in the methods of the invention may be competitive or noncompetitive inhibitors. Competitive inhibitors include substrate analogs (including analogs of a portion of a substrate) which bind to the active site of the enzyme of interest and thereby prevent substrate binding. An inhibitor may inhibit an enzyme with an IC50 of, for example, less than 200, 150, 100, 75, 50, 40, 30, 20, 10, 5, 3, 2, or 1 μM. In certain embodiments, an inhibitor may inhibit an enzyme with an IC50 of less than 1 μM, such as, for example, less than 750, 500, 400, 300, 200, 100 nM. In other embodiments, an inhibitor may inhibit an enzyme with an IC50 of, for example, less than 90, 80, 70, 60, 50, 40, 30, 20, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, or 1 nM.
